derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, augmentative of char 'cart', based on Latin carrus 'wheeled vehicle'

encyclopedia.content: chariot月球车是NASA的最新月球车，12月份才经过测试。NASA花了7个月的时间研制，这个庞然大物比一般月球车大，可以载7到8人。是NASA重返月球计划的月球车测试品。下面是NASA提供的资料： In preparation for the US led effort to build a lunar outpost, NASA has completed the first lunar truck prototype, named Chariot. Realizing the importance of crew and payload mobility on the lunar surface, the Exploration Te

entry.def: In ancient times, chariots were fast-moving vehicles with two wheels that were pulled by horses.

means.word_mean: 1. a light four-wheel horse-drawn ceremonial carriage
2. a two-wheeled horse-drawn battle vehicle; used in war and races in ancient Egypt and Greece and Rome

auth_sentence.content: Chariot racing may finally be over in Rome, afer thousands of years.

Sentence.sentence: Mounted cavalry (骑兵) replaced the chariot (二轮战车) on the battlefield around 1000 BC.
But chariots maintained their place in parades and triumphs right up until the end of the Roman Empire 1,500 years later.
